p: In Cameroon and Congo, the leaves of AC are also used traditionally to treat fever, rheumatism, headache, and colic [ 10, 11]. In Central Africa, it is used traditionally to treat pneumonia; it is also used as an insecticide and nematicide [ 12]. The leaves are also used in dressing wounds and burns, and it has been shown to exhibit antibacterial activity [ 12, 13]. In reunion, the whole plant is used as an antidysenteric activity [ 14]. The whole plant has been used to treat colic, colds, rheumatism, spasms, and diarrhea, and it is also used as a tonic [ 15].
